meanings.definition: To offend or insult someone openly
meanings.sent1: She affronted her friend by ignoring her at the party.
meanings.sent2: He affronted his teacher by talking back in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat affronted the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The loud music affronted her ears, causing her to cover them.
meanings.sent5: The rude comment affronted her sensibilities, leaving her feeling hurt.

meanings.sent1: She looked affronted when he made a joke at her expense.
meanings.sent2: He appeared affronted by the criticism of his work.
meanings.sent3: The affronted expression on her face was priceless.
meanings.sent4: Her affronted pride wouldn't allow her to back down.
meanings.sent5: The affronted customer demanded to speak to the manager.
